Posts.Content: newbie20111 wrote: Anyone have unusual flat red ( non itchy) red rashes while on Herceptin/ Perjeta ? If this thread exists in 2016 please advise. Thanks, Newbie20111 Examples: Recent medical literature has highlighted red rashes which ended up being intradermal ( staph) infections or flat red non itchy rashes which can be cellulitis, or can be an intradermal reoccurrance of invasive ductal carcinoma on the front chest wall. . ( Hard to distinguish between the two). [Staph usually itchy and tends to look like a boil not flat.] Also on Perjeta/Herceptin ...anyone with pin piprick flat birthmarks ( not itchy) ...where they never had them before....( ex. upper arms and on chest in two places) . Also oldage spots on hands and arms if 65 plus. Also anyone dx with cellulitis of the chest while on Perjeta/ Herceptin? Thanks moderators.... Newbie20111 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: StageIV METS Perjeta/Herceptin/ Skin chest rashes newbie20111 newbie20111

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2016 01:23AM newbie20111 wrote: Hi All, Maybe some clarifications on seroma for those new to breast surgery. Anyone can get one, they take time to reabsorb,etc. Some of the descriptions are rather extraordinary and seem like way more than your average seroma.....seems like bad surgery, microbleeds, reconstruction mishaps,etc. Guess there are simple seromas ( those easily drained, or eventually reabsorbed) . Complex seromas...those with large volumes of lymph fluid, microbleeds, reconstruction issues, etc. It would be useful to know whether most seromas are simple or more problematic for the premenopausal crowds, botched surgeries, reconstruction, vs. no reconstruction. When you get one they are kinda creepy, feel like a small silicone implant in the wrong place. For example: I am very post menopausal at 60 plus and I had a very large breast cancer on a large breast and neovalent chemo in right breast and breast and nodes removed. Hardly any bleeding, and no seroma issues. Had radiation after that. Fast forward a year later. Same hospital, same surgeon. Had prophylactic mastectomy, no nodes, extensive bruising ( fingermark bruises ) on chest had a good sized seroma easily drained in breast surgeon office but to this day have slight microbleed discoloration from trauma or perhaps better blood supply or perhaps surgeon used contracted operating help and not as good a job. No reconstruction. (Skin Mets on chest plus local chest wall and subclavian nodes a half a year later after rads and chemo. Seroma side ok. ) . Now NED on Perjeta/Herceptin after doxitacel. Newbie20111 ( newbienomore)
Posts.Title: Does a seroma always have to be drained? ducky179 Lemint

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2015 06:15PM newbie20111 wrote: Somehow, the 5 year mark came to be the benchmark. It is so so arbitrary as far as I am concerned. Sort of like an explorer climbing K 2...Or Everest. Some climbers make it, some dont. All make an effort. Even doctors and hospice personnel can't really guess when a person will start the dying process or die. Organizations like Metavivors ( locally started in MD where I live) are trying to use good science and get researchers to focus on the 30 percent of us whose METS cancer gets 2percent of funding...not the C for Cure word, but treatment so we hang around longer and with better quality of life. For example, In 2009 I was dx with microcalcifications that a major university breast center said wasn't cancer but to "keep an eye on it." Fast forward to 2012...Dx with Stage 3 with a humongous tumor in a large dense rt.breast and had port installed. Neovalent TCH and additional Herceptin, Rads, nodes,rt. mast, etc. Lymphedema fall 2012. 2013 Issues with balance etc. because of my uni. NED.....short term memory issues more or less resolved... 2014 June Had propy. left mast, port removed. NED ....Balance great. Breast free great. Got my life back. 2014 Sept -Dec Reoccurrence and Dx Mets: axila lump mets, axila mets,chest wall mets, subclavian all on bc side Jan-March TPH ( doxetaxel/perjeta/herceptin). Finally bought a wig...Makes me look 30years younger! 2015 Clear scans, all mets cleared up first month...Now NED..Continue on Perjeta/Herceptin. Think it was the doxetacel not the PH that worked mostly. Toxic fingers, thin hair, very dry skin, some lower body edema with perjeta, some dumping. Lymphedema some better. Veins on left arm worn out. Port to be installed on Monday. Running out of body real estate.Some PTSD..hardly worked through the 2012 treatment. So what should I expect...My spouse the optimist is shooting for upwards of 10 years. I am facing my mortality and tired of undergoing treatment. My psyche has really taken a hit with this reoccurence which was not unexpected, but really has left me wondering. Have several chemo buddies on their third tour of duty.....some fourth.. How much can a body take..Have a friend with bone mets on a clinical trial getting good results with minimum side effects.. Chemo treatment may be coming out of the dark ages 20th century to the light of day of the 21st century but the cancer within always wins..or something else gets us. Have a friend who is 93 made it through WWII, still living, early melanoma,whose son came back from Viet Nam wounded with friendly fire shapnel and malaria only to have a car wreck on Mother's Day while driving drunk...still living...Had a 90 year old friend whose sister died in the 1918 flu epidemic. Friend died during a nap waiting to go party on Valentine's Day. No cancer, ate horribly. Lived frugally in the house she was born in. Life is for the living. Winston Churchill said " When you are going through Hell, just keep going" . Guess that's us! Let's boycott the 5 year rule ..Ha! Let's make up our own rules....Carpe Diem! Seize the Day! We need to be thinking NOW.....That's all we have. Thanks for being here. Family just doesn't get it. Docs really don't know especially with the newer treatments for those with old breast cancers...or oldies with new breast cancers. Turning 65 this year. Doubt I will reach 70. Family members died of old age. Old age ( and cancer treatment) is not for sissies.
Posts.Title: 15 -20% 5 year survival rate..huh? LeeLee38 JeninMichigan

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2015 07:50AM newbie20111 wrote: Just woke up with bad cramps of both calves early early this morning after a very sound sleep. Should have known better. Last night, had a whole beer and salty chips and CRS ( couch potato sysndrome..two many tv series taped) ...usually only have a 1/2 beer once in a blue moon and no chips....moderation please! What works for me..definately bar of soap....under bed... Also Boiron makes some awesome products for muscle cramps: Placed under the tongue, works fast... Comes in Homeopathic doses either 6 or 30 c follow directions on tube. Magnesium phosphorica,cuprum metallicum,zinc metallicum. oked by my onco doc...dont take on chemo days. ( I also walked my dog twice yesterday, did chair yoga, and also acupuncture. Maybe I did too much. Also went on vacation this past week, lots of walking, hiking, climbing stairs, came back home and swept the porch, laundry, raked the path....too much of a good thing!) Live life! Today is a "Die In" in DC....177 people will be reinacting the people who will die today of METS BC. There in spirit. Recently had two friends die of BC Not a Newbie anymore. NED at the moment....Had BC twice. Mets since Sept. '14 dx Jan '15. Scans in Nov. PS: Highly recommend the annual Johns Hopkins Couples retreat given in the fall. Just happened. They also have a spring version but with daughters and caregivers.Also check out their Ask the expert column..Lillie Shockney writes it. You will get a real person reply. Thousands of questions answered. Free
Posts.Title: A fix for those awful leg cramps. sueopp sueopp

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2015 12:25PM newbie20111 wrote: Be careful with gabapentin..very strong stuff. I could not take it. caused me to be dizzy, could not write my name or compose a thought. Careful driving too. Falls risk as well. Have you tried magnesium/copper/zinc combos, chair yoga, etc. acupuncture... I too have tight calves...( recently climbed a lighthouse..very tight) I also do the soap in the bed thing. Too much sitting ( tv) is really bad. Have you tried an epsom salt bath? Hope this helps. It could be your chemo dose.... Good luck. Consider if NED to take a chemo holiday to see if leg cramps lessen...
Posts.Title: A fix for those awful leg cramps. sueopp sueopp

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2016 12:54AM newbie20111 wrote: We often forget that breasts are very dynamic throughout our lives and many factors contribute to their changes: breast cancer treatment, infections,anatomy, hormones,trauma, aging,etc. Guess the bottom line is know thy breasts (chest), chest wall and axillas ( armpits) .If it seems abnormal or different maybe it is. Get it checked out, get a second opionion, and if you have cancer treatment expect some pretty radical changes. Be kind to yourself and work with your body. After initial healing seek complementary treatments such as lymphedema therapy,acupuncture, safe exercise and get off the couch, walk the dog, take the stairs, and go live your life. Heart,brain,soul

These issues seem unique to this protocol. More info is needed in this area. ex. cyclical bloating /explosive diarreah ex. cyclical red and itchy feet ex. excessively dry skin ex. fixated hand joints ex. periodic stiffness ex. cyclical runny nose Thanks in advance.
